title: Son of Falcons coordinator behind Sanders prank
content: The son of Falcons defensive coordinator Jeff Ulbrich admitted to being the one behind a prank call to Shedeur Sanders during Day 2 of the NFL draft.

title: Commanders, D.C. reach deal for stadium at RFK
content: The Commanders agreed to a deal with the District of Columbia to build a new stadium at the RFK site, sources told ESPN.

title: Ant zooms past 'gassed' Lakers to take 3-1 lead
content: Anthony Edwards was able to "keep my foot on the pedal" and take advantage of a gassed Lakers team to the tune of 16 points in the fourth quarter.

title: Fan ejected after taunting Red Sox OF Duran
content: A fan in Cleveland was ejected Sunday after saying "something inappropriate" to Boston's Jarren Duran, who revealed in a documentary earlier this month that he attempted suicide three years ago.

title: Officials admit error with Knicks-Pistons ending
content: Crew chief David Guthrie said referees missed Knicks guard Josh Hart's foul of Detroit's Tim Hardaway Jr. on the final shot of the Pistons' loss to the Knicks in Game 4 on Sunday.

title: Saigo wins LPGA major Chevron in 5-way playoff
content: Mao Saigo of Japan won the Chevron Championship on Sunday for her first major title, making a 3-foot birdie putt on the first hole of a five-way playoff.

title: Giants' Ramos walks it off with little league HR
content: Heliot Ramos gave the Giants a walk-off 3-2 win over the Rangers with a Little League home run added by two errors from Texas.

title: Liverpool waited 35 years for this party as Premier League champions, and they earned it
content: Liverpool waited 30 years and then won the Premier League during a pandemic. Now they've won again, and they can finally celebrate.

title: Even Man City's worst could result in an FA Cup trophy
content: Man City won't declare success, but they can still win an FA Cup and a spot in next season's Champions League.

title: Browns gamble on Shedeur Sanders after drafting Dillon Gabriel: What's the plan?
content: Answering the biggest questions surrounding Cleveland's selection of Sanders in the fifth round, including reaction from around the league.

title: Wrexham's latest promotion is a miracle. The next will be even harder
content: Wrexham's third straight promotion has them on the Premier League's doorstep. Getting there will be much harder.

title: Slot sings to Klopp after Liverpool clinch PL title
content: Arne Slot sang Jürgen Klopp's name on the pitch at Anfield as Liverpool celebrated their Premier League title win.

title: MLS investigating discrimination in Vancouver win
content: MLS announced it is aware of a reported violation of the league's Non-Discrimination Policy that occurred in Sunday's match between Minnesota United FC and the Vancouver Whitecaps, and will "immediately begin a thorough review of the matter."

title: Arsenal comeback over Lyon 'unexplainable' - boss
content: Arsenal reached their first Women's Champions League final in 18 years on Sunday, taking down French powerhouse Lyon with a remarkable 4-1 away win.

title: Source: Ancelotti, Pérez to hold Madrid exit talks
content: Carlo Ancelotti will meet with Real Madrid president Florentino Pérez in the coming days to discuss the coach's departure from the club, a source told ESPN.

title: Wrexham plan 'no superstars' policy - Parkinson
content: Wrexham will operate a "no superstars and no egos" policy when they target new signings for their Premier League push next season.

title: Sources: Miami waives Gressel before Loons move
content: Inter Miami CF is waiving Julian Gressel, clearing the way for the midfielder to head to Minnesota United FC, sources tell ESPN.

title: McTominay double puts Napoli 3 clear in Serie A
content: Two first-half goals from Scott McTominay helped Napoli to a 2-0 home win against Torino in Serie A on Sunday as the hosts reclaimed the sole lead in the standings with four games left to play.

title: Liverpool clinch Prem title, match Man Utd record
content: Liverpool have been crowned Premier League champions after a 5-1 win over Tottenham on Sunday, securing their 20th league title.

title: 'He's a great leader': Cam Ward displays leadership abilities in texts to Titans draftees
content: The No. 1 pick in the 2025 NFL draft wasted no time building a rapport with his fellow Titans rookies.

title: Eubank Jr. should focus on Canelo, rather than Benn rematch
content: Forget a rematch with Conor Benn, the focus for Chris Eubank Jr should now fully be on Canelo Alvarez

title: The biggest question facing every WNBA team when training camp opens Sunday
content: Who will carry Phoenix into its new era? What will Reese and Cardoso do in Year 2? Are the Fever title contenders?

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man Utd to trigger Cunha's $84M release clause
content: Is Matheus Cunha the man to solve Manchester United's attacking woes? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Massive Protests In US, France, England, Germany Against Pahalgam Attack
content: The demonstrations were held in Canada, Denmark, England, France, Finland, Germany, Spain and the US.

title: Sensex Opens Over 400 Points, Nifty Rises Over 88 Points In Early Trade
content: The Indian equity benchmark indices opened higher on Monday amid mixed global cues, as buying was seen in the PSU bank and financial service sectors in the early trade.

title: 2024 Global Military Spending Hit $2.7 Trillion In Record Surge. Here's Why
content: Amid changing geopolitical relations, wars and rising tensions, the year 2024 saw the steepest rise in worldwide military expenditure since the end of the Cold War, reaching $2.7 trillion, researchers said Monday.

title: Explained: What Is Lapu-Lapu, The Festival At Which Driver Ran Over 11
content: The festival, celebrated especially in the central Philippines, honours Datu Lapu-Lapu, the Filipino chieftain who famously defeated Spanish forces led by Ferdinand Magellan in the Battle of Mactan in 1521 and became a national hero.

title: "Took Time To Reflect": Robert Vadra Clarifies Remarks On Pahalgam Attack
content: Robert Vadra said terrorism in any form was an attack on the soul of humanity and destroyed the fundamental right of humans to live without fear.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Live Updates: Rajnath Singh To Brief PM Modi On Security Preparedness Today
content: Pakistani troops violated ceasefire and initiated "unprovoked" firing across the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir for the fourth straight night.

title: "Balochistan Movement Symbol Of Freedom": Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has said the Balochistan movement in Pakistan is a symbol of indigenous people's aspiration for freedom.

title: Student, Retired Teachers, Lawyer Among 24 Arrested For Remarks On J&K Attack
content: At least 24 people, including 19 in Assam, have been arrested in three states in the northeast over remarks on the terror attack in Pahalgam, which claimed 26 lives, including those of a Navy officer and an officer from the Intelligence Bureau.

title: Israel Strikes South Beirut, Prompting Lebanese Appeal To Ceasefire Guarantors
content: Israel struck south Beirut on Sunday for the third time since a fragile November 27 ceasefire, prompting Lebanese President Joseph Aoun to call on its guarantors France and the United States to force a halt.

title: Student Stabs 3 In A Knife Attack At A South Korean High School
content: A student stabbed three people in a knife attack at a South Korean high school Monday morning and injured two others, police said.

title: Mark Carney Or Pierre Poilievre: Canadians To Choose Their Next PM Today
content: Canadians are set to elect a new government on Monday, as the Liberals led by Mark Carney try to extend their hold on power against Pierre Poilievre's Conservatives.

title: 5 Migrant Workers From Jharkhand, Working In Niger, Kidnapped
content: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren on Sunday sought External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's intervention to bring back the kidnapped migrant workers.

title: Lapu Lapu Festival: 11 Killed In Vancouver Car Rampage, Suspect Charged With Murder
content: The suspect in a Canadian car-ramming attack that left 11 dead at a Filipino street party was charged with murder, police said Sunday, adding that additional charges were anticipated.

title: Asaduddin Owaisi Shreds Pakistan With "Military Budget" Jibe Over Pahalgam
content: Slamming Pakistan once again for the terror attack at Pahalgam, All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) president and Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday said that Pakistan is half a century behind India.

title: Trump's First 100 Days: Voters Still Back US President
content: US President Donald Trump has come racing out of the gates in his second term in office, slashing government agencies, launching trade wars with friends and foes alike and even taking on the judiciary over his immigration crackdown.

title: "No One There": Pak Woman Living In India For 35 Years Told To Go Back
content: Sarada Bai, a Pakistani national, who has been living in India for over 35 years, has been asked by the Odisha police to leave India immediately.

title: Ahead Of Exit Deadline, 2 Pak Nationals Arrested For Illegally Obtaining Indian Voter IDs
content: During a crackdown to identify illegal foreigners in Raigarh district, police received input about Iftikhar and Arnish staying at the house of one Yakub Sheikh.

title: First Targeted Firing In Poonch Sector As Pak Violates Ceasefire Again
content: Relations between India and Pakistan have soured further after the role of a terror group linked to Pakistan-based Lashkar-e-Taiba emerged in the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: JNUSU Election Results: Left Wins 3 Key Posts, ABVP Ends 9-Year Drought
content: Left candidates bagged three of the four central panel posts in the JNUSU election to maintain their foothold in the premier university while the RSS-affiliated ABVP ended a nine-year phase out of office to win the post of joint secretary.

title: All About Elections Canada, The Non-Partisan Body Behind The Polls
content: Canada is set to hold its federal election on April 28. Originally scheduled for October 20, the election date was moved forward when the Governor General dissolved Parliament at Prime Minister Mark Carney's recommendation.

title: Folk singer Neha Singh Rathore booked for 'provocative' social media posts
content: Based on the complaint, police registered a case against the folk singer on multiple charges under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS)

title: Supreme Court dismisses convicts’ appeals in Kannagi-Murugesan honour killings case
content: The High Court had commuted the death penalty of one of the convicts to life imprisonment and acquitted two others of all charges. The conviction and life sentence of nine convicts were upheld

title: Cancel appointments made during Senthilbalaji’s tenure as Transport Minister in 2014, Madras High Court urged
content: A Division Bench of Justices R. Subramanian and G. Arul Murugan is slated to hear the batch of writ appeals on Monday (April 28, 2025)s

title: Centre blocks 16 Pakistani YouTube channels for broadcasting ‘provocative’ content, writes to BBC over reporting on Pahalgam attack
content: Indian government also conveyed its strong sentiments to Jackie Martin, India Head of BBC regarding their reporting on the terror attack, says a government official

title: Rahul Gandhi to visit Rae Bareli, Amethi on April 29-30
content: The leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha will inaugurate a heart unit at Sanjay Gandhi Hospital, Amethi and inspect the ordnance factory located in Munshiganj. File

title: Hybrid ganja case: Actors Shine Tom Chacko, Sreenath Bhasi appear before Excise team for questioning
content: A woman model also appears for questioning. The case pertains to the seizure of 3 kg of hybrid ganja from a resort in Alappuzha on April 1

title: ‘You have acted like ISIS’: Asaduddin Owaisi hits out at Pakistan over Pahalgam terror attack
content: Pakistan always talks about being a nuclear power; they need to remember that if they enter a country and kill innocent people, that country will not sit quietly, Owaisi said

title: Pakistan violates ceasefire in Poonch, Kupwara sectors for fourth consecutive day: Army
content: The Army officials said that Pakistan posts “initiated unprovoked” small arms fire across the LoC in areas opposite Kupwara and Poonch districts

title: Pahalgam attack: Indian diaspora groups counter Pakistani protest in London
content: Indian community in London counter Pakistani protest, chanting patriotic slogans and waving flags, amid tensions over Pahalgam terror attack

title: Actor Jethwani case: CID police could not question IPS officer Anjaneyulu due to health problem
content: The Court gave three days custody of the accused to the CID police, but investigation officers did not question him as per the advise of the doctors

title: Cheetah gives birth to five cubs at Kuno National Park
content: With the new addition, the number of cheetahs and cubs will increase to 29 at the Kuno park, located in Madhya Pradesh’s Sheopur district

title: Time to teach Pakistan a lesson, says Trinamool’s Abhishek Banerjee
content: Diamond Harbour MP Abhishek Banerjee also added that it is time to reclaim Pakistan Occupied KASHMIR (PoK)

title: Murshidabad riots not spontaneous, says fact finding team; demands judicial inquiry
content: The fact-finding report by five civil rights organisations claimed  that  BJP and RSS are using it for their political gains and sowing seeds of Islamophobia . The report claims that “fake BSF raids targeted only Muslim villages” and “police atrocities created an atmosphere of fear in Muslim villages”

title: Govt. brings cybercrime centre I4C under PMLA
content: In a notification dated April 25, the Revenue Department under the Finance Ministry included I4C under Section 66 of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: Dalai Lama may decide on a spiritual successor during 90th birthday events in July: Central Tibetan Administration leader Penpa Tsering
content: Central Tibetan Administration leader recalls Dalai Lama’s 2011 statement that he will consult religious heads of various Buddhist traditions before taking a call; the Sikyong says he hopes for Indian government representation at the celebration to mark the beginning of the ‘Year of Compassion’

title: ‘Private participation will help State make optimal use of National Waterway III’
content: New norms that open up the country’s inland water transport sector to private players are likely to help attract investments in infrastructure development in the sector, say stakeholders

title: Telangana Prisons deptartment tightens the bars with security, tech and staff audit
content: Covers central prisons, district jails, special prisons for women, special sub-jails, sub-jails in State with focus on scanner functionality, search procedure, visitor ID verification, entry record maintenance

title: SC verdict on actions of Governor a victory for States’ rights, says T.N. Chief Minister Stalin
content: At an event held on Sunday, he felicitated former Attorney General of India Mukul Rohatgi and senior advocates of the Supreme Court Abhishek Singhvi, Rakesh Dwivedi, and P. Wilson, whose arguments won the case on Centre-State relations

title: Outsourcing non-core works helps Kochi metro reduce operational cost
content: The comprehensive strategy includes focusing on outsourcing non-core work, embracing digital systems, and leveraging solar energy

title: Skirmishes continue at LoC as India weighs response to Pahalgam attack
content: Naval vessels carry out multiple anti-ship firings to revalidate and demonstrate readiness of platforms, systems and crew for long-range precision offensive strike.

title: Dr. Satish Kumar is new Pro- Vice Chancellor of SRM University-AP
content: Dr. Satish Kumar completed his post-graduation from Andhra University and received his Ph. D from Punjab University. He then pursued a Master’s in Management at the McGill University, Canada

title: Union Minister Kishan Reddy unveils book authored by State Health Minister Satya Kumar
content: A compilation of 89 articles the Minister has written for a Telugu daily, the book  will be available on Amazon from April 28

title: Residents pitch for improved transport infra, new bus routes
content:
As the summer peaks, they have demanded improvement to the Corporation bus shelters, better maintenance of bus route roads under the Corporation, the Highways Department, and the 
NHAI, and better connectivity in the Corporation and Chennai Metropolitan Area

title: Bihar election: Eye on votes, Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal takes part in Dalit Mahapanchayat
content: Top leaders of the Bihar BJP roundly attacked Congress party alleging that party ruled for 65 with the slogan of Garibi Hatao but poor people were never their priority

title: Smoking is a major risk factor for rheumatoid arthritis
content: Speaking at a webinar on “Understanding Arthritis”, they pointed out that smoking is a strong risk factor for rheumatoid arthritis and advocated lifestyle changes, exercises, yoga, and a healthy diet that is low on carbohydrate and sugar but rich in fibre and protein

title: 537 Pakistanis leave via Attari; no order to extend deadline, say officials
content: A government official said that exemption may be granted on grounds of extreme compassion in some cases; 850 people from Pakistan have arrived in India since April 24

title: Gurugram’s Bandhwari landfill site fire doused after 20 hours
content: Concerns raised over frequent fires and poor air quality; about 2,000 metric tonnes of solid municipal waste from Gurugram and Faridabad is dumped at the landfill site every day

title: NIV shares H5N1 genome data in a public database
content: The institute has shared the genome sequence data with the Global Initiative on Sharing All Influenza Data, on April 21, a day aftera report was published in The Hindu about NIV not sharing sequence data before paper publication

title: Bengaluru: Giant cut-outs, flexes dot Govindraj Nagar roads on MLA’s birthday despite ban
content: Large life-sized images of the MLA were painted on public walls, while flexes lined key roads in the locality. Many residents called the displays an eyesore and questioned the blatant violation of civic rules.

title: New heads for govt. medical colleges, teaching hospitals in A.P.
content: AP government appoints new principals for GMCs and superintendents for teaching hospitals, after recent promotion of eight professors to ADME rank

title: Every citizen should take pride in capital Amaravati, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The relaunch of the capital construction works by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on May 2 will mark a major turning point in the State’s history, he says

title: Karni Sena attacks SP MP’s convoy; ‘deadly act’ says Akhilesh Yadav
content: Police suspend local outpost in-charge and beat constable; Akhilesh slams U.P. government, says BJP will ‘fall prey to violent elements’

title: Tamil Nadu Ministers Senthilbalaji, Ponmudy quit on strong court remarks
content: Supreme Court has made it clear that Mr. Senthilbalaji had to make a choice between the Minister’s post and his freedom; Mr. Ponmudy ran into trouble after Madras High Court took up a petition over a derogatory speech; Mano Thangaraj to be inducted into Cabinet

title: Job fairs will continue, says Minister Rajan
content: So far, the job fair has seen 1,246 candidates receiving job offers—with 613 recruited via online interviews and 633 through the on-ground fair

title: K-CIS completes 25,000 inspections
content: The success of K-CIS is an example of how quickly the Industries department is being professionally remoulded, says Kerala Industries and Law Minister

title: Bihar’s new bounce
content: SepakTakraw, originally from Malaysia, and known informally as kick volleyball in India, is now one of Bihar’s 14 priority sports. A mixture of football, volleyball, and a few other sports, it came into the limelight with the world cup being held in Patna towards the end of March. Amit Bhelari traces its growing popularity in Bihar

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Opposition parties may seek special session of Parliament
content: Congress is reaching out to other allies in the INDIA bloc to frame a consensus. “It is under consideration,” a senior Congress leader said.

title: Congress is villain No. 1 of Telangana, says KCR at BRS’ silver jubilee meet
content: The BRS supremo and former chief minister alleges that Congress government has ruined the State’s economy due to lack of experience, its inefficiency

title: J&K attack: Govt writes to BBC over its report terming 'terrorists' as 'militants'
content: The government has formally protested BBC's use of "militants" instead of "terrorists" in its coverage of the Pahalgam attack, which resulted in 26 deaths. Simultaneously, India banned 16 Pakistani YouTube channels, including prominent networks like Dawn News and Geo News, for allegedly spreading misinformation and provocative content against India, its army, and security agencies following the tragic incident.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: J&K assembly holds special session - Top developments
content: Following the tragic Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 tourists, the Jammu and Kashmir Legislative Assembly convened a special session today. India banned 16 Pakistani YouTube channels, including prominent news outlets, for disseminating misinformation against the nation and its security forces.

title: 'You are not just half an hour, but half a century behind': Owaisi mocks Pakistan
content: Amid escalating tensions, AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi strongly criticized Pakistan, citing ceasefire violations and rhetoric following the Pahalgam terror attack. He asserted Pakistan lags behind India, both economically and strategically.

title: Explained: How Rishabh Pant's LSG can still qualify for IPL 2025 playoffs
content: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) suffered a setback after a 54-run defeat against Mumbai Indians, impacting their playoff chances and net run rate. With five wins and five losses, LSG is currently sixth. Mentor Zaheer Khan remains confident in the team's ability to bounce back, emphasizing the need to play good cricket and avoid relying on net run rate.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is not 'happy', says 'We should have been ... '
content: Elon Musk expressed his disappointment that humans haven't reached Mars yet, despite SpaceX's efforts. He referenced the rapid progress from the first flight to the moon landing, highlighting the current delay in space exploration.

title: BSE Sensex over 700 points up, crosses 80,000; Nifty50 above 24,200
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, opened in green on Monday. While BSE Sensex went above 80,000, Nifty50 crossed 24,250.

title: Gold price prediction: What's gold rate outlook for this week
content: Gold prices experienced significant volatility, initially soaring to record highs due to safe-haven demand amid geopolitical and economic uncertainties last week. However, prices corrected sharply following signals of potential trade negotiations and peace efforts. Investors are closely monitoring central bank independence, inflation expectations, and U.S. economic data for future policy direction.

title: How Microsoft CEO helped turn developer’s son’s illness into a free AI health tool
content: Driven by his son's rare disease diagnosis, Microsoft developer Julian Isla founded Foundation 29 to leverage AI in healthcare. Inspired by Satya Nadella's advocacy, Isla created DxGPT, a diagnostic assistant using advanced language models on Microsoft Azure. This tool analyzes symptoms, suggests diagnoses, and offers vital support to families facing complex health challenges, all while prioritizing user privacy.

title: Pahalgam attack: US calls for 'responsible solution' amid India-Pak tensions
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, the United States has called on India and Pakistan to find a responsible solution. The US is closely monitoring the situation and has been in contact with both governments. Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed grief over the attack, which targeted tourists. The attack, the deadliest in the Valley since the 2019 Pulwama strike, targeted mostly tourists and was claimed by The Resistance Front (TRF), a proxy of the Pakistan-based terrorist organisation Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

title: Canada elections 2025: Key candidates, major parties, issues
content: Canadians are heading to the polls in a crucial federal election, triggered by political shifts and trade tensions with the US. Prime Minister Mark Carney faces challenges from Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre and NDP's Jagmeet Singh. Key issues include affordability for younger voters and healthcare for older Canadians, as parties vie for a majority in the House of Commons.

title: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey raises concerns over 'new face of Pakistani terrorism' amid Pahalgam attack fallout
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has alleged a new form of Pakistani terrorism, claiming over five lakh Pakistani women have entered India through marriage but haven't received citizenship. This follows the government's visa restrictions on Pakistani citizens after a deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, which killed 26 people.

title: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan announces layoffs: Read full letter he sent to employees
content: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan announced a restructuring plan involving layoffs and management changes to regain competitiveness. The company aims to cut $1.5 billion in operating expenses over two years, focusing on engineering talent and streamlining processes. A return-to-office mandate of four days a week will also be implemented to foster collaboration and innovation.

title: A musical journey through the life of Raja Ravi Varma
content: Kilimanoor Palace to release a musical album on Ravi Varma on the occasion of his 177th birth anniversary

title: Panel on simultaneous polls to seek film personalities’ view on proposed legislation
content: During their two-day stay at Mumbai in May, the JPC members will also be meeting officials from the RBI, SBI, other banks, and the officials of the Maharashtra State Election Commission

title: Agricultural agenda must move from food security to farmer prosperity: Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: He calls for empowering farmers by creating awareness and by informing them that the government cooperative system was very robust

title: Congress leader from Alur in Kurnool district murdered in Guntakal
content: Assailants hit Lakshminarayana’s car with a tipper and hacked him to death with hunting sickles, say police

title: Panels to monitor adherence to annual pokkali rice and fish cycle
content: The move comes in the wake of complaints from farmers that the coastal paddy fields have not yet been drained in preparation for sowing ahead of the rainy season

title: VAC signals require 6% to 17% manual interference to accommodate Bengaluru traffic
content: According to BTP officials, on average, while these systems run on an automated mode about 94% of the time (in a day), during the remaining 6% (majorly during the evening peak hours) they must be manually operated.

title: Rayala Sports Complex inaugurated in Kurnool
content: District Principal and Sessions Judge G. Kabarthi expresses happiness over the establishment of the complex and asks sports enthusiasts to make use of the facility as it would serve as a good opportunity to hone their skills

title: Delta region’s only coconut marketing complex in Pattukottai remains idle
content: The facility Ponnvarayankadu, built in 2011 at an estimate of ₹8 crore and renovated in 2022, remains non-functional; officials say they plan to hold meeting with farmers

title: Residents oppose felling of 368 trees for commercial project at Cantonment Railway Colony
content: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has issued a public notice inviting objections to the proposed felling of 368 trees located inside the Bangalore Cantonment Railway Colony at Vasanth Nagar.

title: Tamil Nadu government’s financial aid to power utility has risen by around 300% in 10 years
content: A huge financial outgo from the State government to the power utility is one of the key factors for its continued relatively-high revenue and fiscal deficits

title: Members of banned Jamaat-e-Islami launch new political party in J&K
content: People feel that their real representatives are not on the ground and the Justice and Development Front (JDF) has been launched to fill that void, says party general secretary Sayar Reshi. The party’s founding principles are justice, development and public welfare, he says

title: War should be the nation’s last resort, says Siddaramaiah after his statement draws criticism
content: ‘I did not say war against Pakistan is not necessary. What I said was that we are ready for war if needed. War should always be a nation’s last resort-never the first nor the only option’

title: 'Intentions misinterpreted': Robert Vadra clarifies remark on Pahalgam attack
content: Robert Vadra, businessman and husband of Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, has clarified his earlier remark regarding the Pahalgam terrorist attack. In a Facebook post, Vadra condemned the attack, calling it an "attack on the soul of humanity." He emphasized his solidarity with India and stated that no justification exists for violence against innocent people.

title: Tesla Cybertruck owner gets stuck in water after believing Elon Musk’s claims
content: A Tesla Cybertruck owner in California tested Elon Musk's claims about water capabilities. The owner activated 'Wade Mode' to cross water. Unfortunately, the Cybertruck got stuck, needing help from California Highway Patrol. Musk had suggested it could handle rivers, but the warranty advises caution. This incident shows the importance of understanding a vehicle's limits, despite marketing claims.

title: Pakistan violates ceasefire for fourth consecutive night, India responds
content: Pakistani troops have violated the ceasefire along the Line of Control for the fourth consecutive night, initiating unprovoked firing in the Poonch and Kupwara districts of Jammu and Kashmir, according to Indian Army officials. This escalation follows a recent terror attack in Pahalgam, where 26 Hindu tourists were killed.

title: 'This is my ground': Virat Kohli recreates Kantara scene to tease KL Rahul
content: Virat Kohli playfully mocked KL Rahul's 'this is my ground' Kantara celebration after Royal Challengers Bengaluru defeated Delhi Capitals. This was in response to Rahul's earlier celebration at Chinnaswamy Stadium after guiding Delhi to victory against RCB. Krunal Pandya's unbeaten 73 and Kohli's 51 helped RCB chase down the target of 162.

title: Pahalgam attack victim Shubham Dwivedi’s wife seeks martyr status for him
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, the widow of Shubham Dwivedi, a 31-year-old businessman killed in the incident, is appealing to the government to grant her husband martyr status. Aishanya Dwivedi emphasized the importance of remembering victims and ensuring Shubham's sacrifice is recognized, highlighting the family's grief and desire for peace.

title: Udit Raj slams Tharoor over Pahalgam remarks: Trying to be a super-BJP man?
content: Congress leader Udit Raj criticised Shashi Tharoor's remarks on the Pahalgam terror attack, questioning his allegiance to the party and suggesting he was acting as a BJP spokesperson. Raj challenged Tharoor's comparison of the attack to the intelligence failure in Israel during the Hamas strike. He further inquired about Tharoor's knowledge of terror attacks in America post-9/11.

title: Morning news wrap: Pak violates ceasefire again, 509 Pak nationals leave India & more
content: Tensions escalate along the LoC as Pakistan violates the ceasefire for the fourth consecutive night, prompting a strong response from India. Following the Pahalgam terror attack, over 500 Pakistani nationals have exited India after visa revocations. Meanwhile, US President Trump urges Putin to pursue peace talks with Ukraine amidst ongoing conflict and missile strikes.

title: Naga Chaitanya enjoys laid-back Sunday with wife Sobhita Dhulipala and dog Hash
content: Naga Chaitanya is soaking in the weekend vibes, giving fans a sweet glimpse into his laid-back Sunday with wife Sobhita Dhulipala and their adorable pet dog, Hash. Taking to Instagram, the actor posted cozy pictures capturing moments with Hash, while Sobhita was seen relaxing beside him. Several fans pointed out that Hash was once known as the pet Naga Chaitanya shared with his ex-wife Samantha Ruth Prabhu.

title: 'Stop shooting and sign a deal': Trump to Putin after meeting Zelenskyy
content: Donald Trump has expressed his disappointment with Vladimir Putin, urging him to cease hostilities in Ukraine and finalize a peace agreement. Following a meeting with Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Trump criticized Putin's attacks on civilian areas, suggesting a potential shift in strategy towards Russia. Efforts to broker a deal continue, with the US proposing a controversial plan involving recognition of Russian-occupied territories.

title: Virat Kohli and KL Rahul exchange words during DC vs RCB match
content: During a match against Delhi Capitals, Virat Kohli was seen in a heated argument with KL Rahul, though the reason remained unclear. Kohli's fifty, along with Krunal Pandya's unbeaten 73, propelled Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a six-wicket victory, securing their top position in the IPL table.

title: Watch: Ravi Bishnoi celebrates after smashing Jasprit Bumrah for a six
content: Ravi Bishnoi's unexpected sixes and Jasprit Bumrah's milestone weren't enough as Mumbai Indians defeated Lucknow Super Giants by 54 runs. Bumrah's impressive 4 for 22 not only secured the win but also made him the highest wicket-taker for Mumbai Indians in IPL history, surpassing Lasith Malinga. Mumbai's victory was fueled by strong batting performances from Ryan Rickelton and Suryakumar Yadav.

title: Supreme Court to hear plea seeking ban on explicit content on OTT platforms
content: The Supreme Court of India is scheduled to hear a petition advocating for a ban on sexually explicit content on OTT platforms and social media. Petitioners urge the establishment of a National Content Control Authority to regulate online pornography, citing concerns about its impact on youth, societal values, and public safety.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for the week starting today
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services recommends ICICI Bank and 360 One WAM as top stock picks for the week starting April 28, 2025. ICICI Bank's Q4 performance showcased robust growth. 360 ONE reported record PAT, fueled by recurring revenue growth.

title: 'Bharat will vanish': Dehradun fruit-seller booked for ‘anti-India comment’
content: Police registered a case against fruit seller Ziauddin in Dehradun after a Bajrang Dal member alleged he overheard him making anti-India remarks about the India-Pakistan conflict. Charged under BNS section 152, the investigation is ongoing. This incident follows a series of nationwide actions against individuals accused of anti-national comments after the Pahalgam terror attack on April 22.

title: Actress Navina Bole makes shocking accusations about Sajid Khan
content: Actress Navina Bole, known for her roles in 'Ishqbaaz' and 'Mile Jab Hum Tum,' has accused filmmaker Sajid Khan of inappropriate behavior. In an interview, Bole revealed that Khan allegedly invited her to his home and asked her to "take off her clothes." She recounted feeling deeply uncomfortable during the encounter, which occurred in the mid-2000s.

title: US doctor warns that eating chia seeds like this can land you in the hospital
content: Chia seeds have surged in popularity as a superfood, lauded for their nutritional benefits. However, consuming them dry poses risks, as highlighted by Dr. Salhab, potentially leading to esophageal blockages requiring surgery. Soaking chia seeds is crucial; it aids digestion, prevents discomfort, and enhances nutrient absorption, unlocking their full potential for optimal health benefits.

title: Environmentalist defend conocarpus plant, slam ‘unscientific attack’
content: Originating in Yemen, the Conocarpus plant is now widely grown in countries like Dubai, Kuwait, and Abu Dhabi, contributing to 70 percent of their green cover

title: Thiruvananthapuram airport, railway station receive hoax bomb threats
content: The police swiftly responded with precautionary measures, though operations at both prominent transit hubs remained unaffected

title: Union Minister exhorts States to contribute to achieving energy consumption target
content: State Designated Agencies urged to adopt Energy Conservation and Sustainable Building Code for commercial buildings, and Eco Niwas Samhita for residential buildings

title: As mercury level goes up, price of tender coconut skyrockets in Bengaluru
content: Tender coconut growers also cite declining yield and changing environmental conditions for the shortage in supply eventually leading to soaring prices.

title: Applications invited for higher secondary teacher transfer for 2025-26
content: Government wants to complete transfers by the end of May to facilitate joining of teachers in their new schools before June 1

title: Vizag police bust nine-member gang allegedly involved in loan app fraud, seize ₹60 lakh worth cryptocurrency
content: The prime accused in the case has confessed that he has been lured into committing the crime by two Chinese cybercriminals, says Commissioner of Police Shankabratha Bagchi

title: Nellore police bust seven-member cybercriminal gang
content: Chinna Bazar police officials arrest five persons from Rajasthan and two locals, who duped a woman of ₹2.46 crore in online investment scam

title: Kevin Pietersen: 'I back KL Rahul to bat at No. 4 for India in T20 cricket'
content: KL Rahul, after a stellar performance in ODIs, including the 2023 World Cup and Champions Trophy, aims to reclaim his spot in India's T20I squad for the 2026 T20 World Cup. Despite being overlooked for the recent T20 World Cup, his current form in the IPL 2025, where he is the leading run-scorer for Delhi Capitals, is promising.

title: Pahalgam attack fallout: 'Shoot us, but don't throw us out of India'
content: Rezia Sultana, a 72-year-old Pakistani national residing in India since childhood, faces deportation following the Pahalgam terror attack. Living in Soro town, Odisha, she pleads with the government to reconsider, citing her lifelong residence and critical kidney-related medical appointment. Her family appeals for the withdrawal of the deportation notice, emphasizing her deep roots in India.

title: Bharat Mata Ki Jai drowns Pakistan Zindabad in London protest after J&K terror attack
content: Hundreds of Indian-origin supporters overwhelmed a smaller Pakistani protest outside the Indian High Commission in London following the Pahalgam terrorist attack. The Indian side, displaying the Tricolour and chanting patriotic slogans, outnumbered the Pakistani protesters who were raising slogans against PM Modi. The incident has sparked debate in the UK, with right-wing commentators questioning the success of multiculturalism.

title: In Uttar Pradesh, Aadhaar touts clone 'deputy CM'
content: A sting operation near the Uttar Pradesh Assembly in Lucknow exposed a thriving tout racket at an Aadhaar Seva Kendra. Touts, in collusion with staff from Smart Chip Private Limited, fabricated identities for a fee. UIDAI officials confirmed the irregularities after their own investigation and have initiated further probes and filed an FIR.

title: Eye on Pak, India flexes muscle in Arabian Sea
content: India is increasing pressure on Pakistan along land and sea borders. The Army is retaliating strongly to ceasefire violations along the LoC, while the Navy conducts missile firings in the Arabian Sea. The IAF is also flying long-range fighter sorties, signaling readiness for potential punitive strikes if the government decides to act.

title: India-Pakistan tension, FPIs to decide trend on D-Street
content: Geopolitical tensions between India and Pakistan, triggered by the Pahalgam terror attack, are casting a shadow over Dalal Street. Market sentiment will also be influenced by foreign fund trading patterns, quarterly earnings from Indian and US companies, and overall trends in US markets.

title: Pahalgam attack aftermath: Deadline over, 509 Pak nationals leave via Attari
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India revoked most visas for Pakistani citizens, leading to 509 Pakistani nationals exiting via Attari. Simultaneously, 744 Indian nationals returned from Pakistan through Wagah. The revocation, part of a diplomatic response, set deadlines for various visa categories, with states instructed to ensure compliance and address overstays under the Immigration and Foreigners Act.

title: ‘Jaat’ Box Office Day 18: Sunny Deol’s film stays strong; inches towards Rs 90cr
content: Sunny Deol's 'Jaat,' also starring Randeep Hooda, continues its strong performance at the box office, nearing Rs 90 crore after 18 days. Despite competition from Akshay Kumar's 'Kesar 2' and Emraan Hashmi’s ‘Ground Zero,’ 'Jaat' saw a rise in collections over the weekend, with Sunday marking its highest earning day in the third week.

title: Blood boiling but national unity will steer Pahalgam response: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has vowed to punish those behind the Pahalgam attack, emphasizing the unity of 1.4 billion Indians as a powerful force against terrorism. He assured justice for the victims' families, promising a strong response to the perpetrators and their supporters.

title: Man who 'shot UP biryani seller over Pahalgam' held
content: Agra police have apprehended Manoj Chaudhary, who claimed to be a 'gau rakshak' and member of Kshatriya Gau Raksha Dal, for allegedly murdering a biryani seller. Chaudhary initially asserted the killing was retaliation for the Pahalgam attack, a claim police dismissed. Authorities believe the crime stemmed from a dispute over the biryani's quality, not vigilantism.

title: Indian rulers in, Mughals out of Std 7 textbooks
content: Class VII NCERT social science textbooks have removed references to the Mughals and Delhi Sultanate, replaced with chapters on ancient Indian dynasties and "sacred geography." The revisions, aligning with NEP 2020, aim to incorporate Indian traditions and philosophies, featuring Indian writers and themes in English textbooks while also highlighting government initiatives and constitutional rights.

title: 12 killed as van hits biker, plunges into well in Madhya Pradesh
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Mandsaur district, a tragic accident occurred when a van, heading to Aantari Mata Temple, collided with a bike, killing the biker. The van then plunged into a well, resulting in the death of ten passengers. A local villager died while rescuing passengers from the toxic well, and four others sustained critical injuries.

title: How Liverpool won the 2024-25 Premier League, in pictures
content: the reds have clinched the 2024-25 premier league title, their first since 2020-21 and their first under new manager Arne Slot . the club have 24 wins and just two defeats in 33 matches, with four games remaining . this season, there were plenty of dramatic moments along the way to july .

title: Western Conference playoffs: LeBron, Luka cannot save Lakers from 3-1 hole
content: the 2024-25 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . the no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets evened the series with the No. 5 seed LA Clippers after an exciting Game 4 .

title: Draft overreactions on Sanders, Cousins, Giants, Jags and Steelers
content: the 2025 draft featured an entire sub-industry of overreaction around one particular player who ended up being the 144th pick by the Browns . the discourse was on fire when the second and third rounds ended Friday night and Sanders still hadn't been drafted .

title: Eastern Conference playoffs: Takeaways from every game, including Knicks' narrow win
content: a controversial no-call on Tim Hardaway Jr.'s 3-point attempt results in the Knicks narrowly winning Game 4 over the Pistons . the Cleveland Cavaliers took a commanding 3-0 lead over the Miami Heat on Saturday without Darius Garland, handing the Heat their worst-ever playoff loss .

title: Report: Possible Achilles injury for Bucks' Lillard
content: Damian Lillard suffered an apparent leg injury in the first quarter . the Milwaukee Bucks star is scheduled to undergo an MRI on Monday . he was injured while trying to secure an offensive rebound midway through the first half . "just being honest, it's not very promising," coach Doc Rivers says postgame .

title: 6-team mock draft: How early did Paige Bueckers go?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is set to tip off on may 16, the ESPN experts came together for a fantasy women's basketball mock draft . we used the default settings -- a six-team league with nine players per team and the following scoring system . the participants of this mock draft were Charlie Creme, Eric Moody, Jason Shebilske, andre Snellings .

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players
content: Clayton Powell-Lee has spent the past month searching for an answer . he can build on his 53 tackles last season, after which he landed a six-figure name, image and likeness contract with the school . the market for defensive backs is booming, his agents say .

title: Lions sixth-round pick Ahmed Hassanein proposes to girlfriend after being drafted
content: Ahmed Hassanei is now the first Egyptian to be drafted into the NFL . the former boise State Broncos pass rusher proposed to his girlfriend . he was drafted by the nfl in the 2025 draft .
